meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of oak wood.
meanings.sent1: The oaky table was sturdy and strong.
meanings.sent2: The room had an oaky scent from the wooden furniture.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel built its nest in the oaky tree, feeling right at home.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had an oaky quality, deep and rich like aged wood.
meanings.sent5: The oaky texture of the bark was rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: Having a taste or aroma reminiscent of oak.
meanings.sent1: The wine had an oaky flavor that lingered on the palate.
meanings.sent2: The whiskey had a smooth, oaky finish.
meanings.sent3: The chef added an oaky twist to the dish, surprising the diners.
meanings.sent4: The air was filled with the oaky scent of burning wood.
meanings.sent5: The oaky aroma of the forest enveloped them as they walked.

meanings.definition: Covered or filled with oak trees.
meanings.sent1: The oaky forest provided shade on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: The path led through an oaky grove, sunlight filtering through the leaves.
meanings.sent3: The campers set up their tents in the oaky clearing, surrounded by nature.
meanings.sent4: The oaky woods whispered secrets in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The oaky canopy above rustled with the breeze, a peaceful sound.
